name: Guillermo Flores V
title: Great console
text: Recommend this over a PS4 Pro. Never had fan/over-heating problems with this PS4 compared to it's older model. Not too heavy or bulky. Have had this console for over a year now and have had zero problems with it. 100% recommend.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Controller did not work, charging cable had exposed wires.
text: Arrived with controller that will not charge. Also arrived with charging cable that had exposed wires which also does not work (tested separately). This was a gift, I am very disappointed. At least the PS4 is functional, but now we have to spend more money on controllers and cables.My own PS4 had none of these problems, purchased from a different source.

name: Han Solem
title: Couldn't pass up the Prime Day deal
text: Probably my best Prime Day purchase. The Blu-Ray quality is superior to anything else I've used, so that alone is worth it. The fact I received Spider-Man and Horizon Zero Dawn with it for $200 is just icing on the cake.

name: Courtney Burton Lavender
title: DON’T BUY! Zero stars!!!
text: A complete and total joke! Had this play station for one month, only played it a couple times and it won’t turn on any more. Don’t waste your time, all this product did was frustrate me and my family! Go to an actual store and find one that works this is completely stupid! They won’t even return 100% of my money either, they are making me pay for labor costs when they are the ones that delivered a bad product! DONT BUY!!!!

name: J Walters
title: Love it!
text: Coming from gaming on a PC, I've always wanted a PS4 to play some MLB. Sucks it's just on PS, but I think it's worth it. I've used a XBOX controller most of my PC life. The PS controller seems to be a bit more comfortable.

name: aylin yin
title: but the quality is nice, easy to set up
text: noticed a few glitches on it when i'm using it. but the quality is nice, easy to set up. still getting the hang of it, never owned a PS before.

name: My name is mommy

text: Was on my door step the next day. Works well.Was a gift for my husband and he loves it.Favorite thing about it is how quiet it is. Can't even tell when its on.

name: Tatiana R.

I was reading some of the one start reviews and even people who buy there PlayStations from Sony themselves sometimes get the issues people where talking ab. Anyways it works fine. it heats up a little bit but nothing to hot. But overall a five stars from me so far.

name: Amazon Customer

name: DeVaughn Morgan

name: Tammy Yeck

text: Our boys absolutely love their PS4 and we are very satisifed with our purchase. It arrived in a timely fashion and it works great. No complaints!!!

name: No_Name

name: Sydney McBroom

Much to my surprise someone must've f****d up the order because I got a brand new console that wasn't even opened. Its the one time where I'm actually happy someone made a mistake....HOORAY!!!  \ (^_^) /It goes without saying since its brand new its worked flawlessly.

name: Kindle Customer

It's lightweight, so I'm able to easily carry it to friends houses. I'm still figuring out all the stuff on it, but so far I have no complaints.

name: Alejandra
title: Super
text: Excelente funciona super bien

It comes with all the cords and a little headset ( though it is kinda cheap) so that you can use it till you can get an actual one

name: Amy

Other than this initial issue, it has been fantastic and I have had no other issues.

name: Annie
title: When the Sony Warranty runs out, I have Square Trade. Just don't know why I have to wait that long...
text: Does not work, right from the box it was broken. Could not return. Our family took a rare vacation to visit family this Christmas, by the time we gothome, and our children opened their gifts here, the was PlayStation was out of warranty to return. Luckily, I had also bought the protection planfrom Square Trade. I do recommend that to everyone that is offered that for their electronics. The warranty is still in effect for the PlayStationthrough the Sony company. We have already sent it in once, and it came back the same. They are continuing to work with me on this in the  hopes of figuring out the problem with the console.This system costs a lot of money, along with it I bought games, contriollers, and other supplies. It is disappointing that my children's biggest and most wanted Christmas gift can not be used, could not ever be used because it will not connect to the tv. That it is nearly April, and they are still waiting. I don't understand why a brand new never used PlayStation could not be replaced with another one, quick and simple.I do not know why I had to buy a HDMI cord, to see if the cord is the problem. And they could not of checked that while it was in service.Since it has been a connection problem, from the beginning.

name: mcgeehe
title: It's a PS4 for $200, how could this go any other way?
text: I got this during the Black Friday sale (2017) for $200. For that price, it's a great deal, IMO. You get a nice Blu-Ray player and streaming box that can also play PS4 exclusives @ 1080p, it compliments my PC very well. Don't think I'd pay more than $200 for one though unless I didn't have a gaming PC. Don't think I could recommend PS+, you get all the same benefits on PC for no extra charge, but if you happen to want to play a PS4 game online, there isn't any other option. At the normal price of $300, I'd give this a 3 out of 5 stars.Amazon/USPS delivered next day (Prime WA to WA) <3

name: Saxon Henry
title: ... it comes to online subscriptions and online services are pretty good. The machine has plenty of memory for ...
text: I used to be an Xbox guy but I prefer the PlayStation now simply because the machine is much more customizable and much more convenient when it comes to online subscriptions and online services are pretty good. The machine has plenty of memory for games and the download speed is pretty good. Also there is a wide range of games to play including virtual reality Wich isn't found on any other console platform. I didn't Kno that PlayStation 4 controllers have built in mouse touch on them and speakers. I was amazed when I first noticed sounds coming out of my controller also there is an indicator light that let's you know where your battery life is and the light reacts with games for example it turns red when you're health is low in a game or blue or green when you're health is fine. All in all PlayStation is a cool machine. As long as you have a TV that has HDMI input you can turn it on and start gaming

title: Best ever!! ?
text: Update:12/25/17 We have a winner! I could attempt to tell you, in highly technical terms, why this system rocks. But I would fail. Last video game I played was Space Invaders and that was 1977. But I did my research and read my reviews and I think I got the best one. Most important it’s the one my 10 year old son wants. title: Great buy, 1TB PS4 for $200 is the perfect gift but beware there appears to be issues with the remotes.
text: Awesome over all. Console is nice and sleek, not to mention its 1TB!!! but I’m already experiencing issues with the remote and I just got it Monday. My remote turned on but did not connect to my PS4. I plugged the USB and it still did not connect. Now my remote is on but won’t charge or connect to the console and it won’t turn off either. Also the USB ports on the remote and console seem to be difficult to connect a USB wire to it. Example: difficult to plug and unplug. Even the WPS (WiFi Protection Setup) was having issues at first connecting but it eventually did. I do not know what’s going on with my remote, I barely bought it Monday and it was working the first time I used it, attempted to watch a movie (second time I use it) when the remote just stayed on but can not connect, charge or turn off. Any help?

name: Ben C
title: If you don't have a need for 4k, or VR this system has you covered.
text: Works as expected, seems to be more stable than my previous model. I have not had one blue screen yet with this system. Had to replace my older PS4  due to what I suspect is a power supply failure. This one has much better internet connection over WiFi than the one I replaced. Haven't experienced the full lobby one second, mass exodus of players later issue in GTA, not that it is always a bad thing... But, still seems like PSN is still slowing downloads. As even over a 100gbs connection is still slow to download full games, or DLC.  That is not the systems fault though. I like the smaller foot print this system has. Looks nice next to my Super slim PS3.

title: Best system ever!
text: I have had this particular version of the system for about a month or two now. I haven't regretted this decision even for a second. I had the original PS4 but I wanted to upgrade to something that is sleeker and has more space.Pros--A lot faster than the original-You're able to play all the same games-You can basically do anything you want on it, like, I have Spotify, Hulu, Netflix, and a whole ton of games.Cons--I honestly can't think of a single one!It comes with a new version of the controller with an awesome light bar ON the touch pad AND it comes with a thick wire to charge the controller with. Absolutely love this system and I know you will too!

title: or are horrible as, a split screen mode)
text: Got this a few months ago, and it runs well, still plenty of memory, and no issues to gripe about at all.  I mean it's a Sony PS console so there's usually not much to complain about unless you get a factory defect I guess.  I appreciate that the price was reasonable so we can all play together on separate consoles as a family (some games are not available as, or are horrible as, a split screen mode).It would be nice if Sony as a company would allow PS Plus accounts to be used across several consoles (like Netflix allows accounts across a few different users on different screens) so we had to sign our kiddo up for a separate account to use and play a lot of the games with friends or even with us in the same house.

text: Yeah I know I’m late on owning this console as the new one is about to “release” in January  but that doesn’t matter  PS4 is legit! Was kind of sad to see it not coming the day before but overall happy it didn’t come 5 days later  had to buy protection separately since it wasn’t offered when I purchased mine, but highly recommend a protection plan just in case, a buddy of mine told me his went bad after three months. SquareTrade is a good protection service. I use them on most of my device. You will NOT regret purchasing this PlayStation 4 console. One down fault though  You need PlayStation Plus to play online... Kind of bs to me but oh well

title: Brand New and doesnt work
text: I purchased this for my son for Christmas and he was so excited!! Hooked it up and it wont turn on.  Went through all the trouble shooting that I read online and nothing.  Looks like I got a dud.  Needless to say my son was crushed.  I called Amazon and they advised me to call Sony and see what they say.  I have called Sony 3 days in a row now and been on hold for over an hour each day and cant get through.  Amazon said I could return the PS4 and get my money back but I just want to exchange it for one that works.  I got this one for such a good deal and I would not have purchased it other wise.  If I return it I have to pay way more money to get the same product.  IF I can get this resolved I will change my review but as it is now I have a 9 year old boy with nothing he can use as Christmas presents.

name: Matthew McGinley (real name™)
title: I figured out what the deal is...
text: The PS4, Playstation 4, has the best graphics to date. Mind blowing, ultra-realistic graphics. The console is very quiet and the 1 TB drive is unbelievably responsive and efficient. However, the whole idea of gaming now with the PS4 is that of commerciality, or perpetual purchases. On the older systems, the PS1 and PS2, for example, when you bought a game, all of the features were on the disc, although some of them may have been locked. The way it works now is they practically give you the game for a token payment. When you set up your playstation account, then they have you. Now you have to buy "extras" for the game online, and in many cases you have to be online to play your game, so Sony is always watching you. Instead of a complete game for $49, for example, you pay $29 for the initial game, but to get all the bonuses, extras and "easter eggs" you might have to pay up to $500 or more, $1.49 or $2.99 at a time. It really is marketing genius.Once I realized how it works now, then I immediately sold my system and regressed back to the PS2, the best game platform ever made--a contradiction to my earlier statement. I say this because with the older systems you are safe, off the grid, and Sony or Big Brother cannot see you or track what you are doing. I like it better this way. Safer. Cleaner. More secure. Cozy and safe, away from watchful eyes and hacks that could somehow break into your account and steal your financial data making you a target for identity thieves who could easily steal your bank account information. That's the way the PS4, and soon-to-be-released PS5  systems work now--everything is done online, and very little of it now is done off the grid, away from the mainframe and spying corporate eyes who are going to milk you for every dollar. I hope this information helps you, too, avoid potential financial problems and being a victim of profiteering pricing.Another thing is, you have no power to stop the updates. The game will get to a point where it will not let you play it until it is updated, even if you have the physical CD for it. This is so not right. If the game is not finished or it needs updating, why not wait until it's done instead of half-baked? So, as I mentioned, with the older PS1 and PS2, there are thousands of games already done for those systems that don't need updating and don't need an internet connection to play, so the best move is one step forward, three steps back, and that's where I will stay.I hope there are some programmers out there who write new games for the ps1 and ps2 and cause an older game system revival. I hope there are some marketing people and programmers who have a SHRED of respect for their customers and not just their own bank accounts.From the navigation menu, there is no option to delete your Playstation account. You have to call a phone number and tell them WHY, which is really none of their business. All these voice command things like Alexa, Infinity and now Playstation getting their mitts deeper into our lives and our pockets--do not let them do this. Sell your system and detach yourself from the grid! It's so much safer that way.

name: Joel C. Keilson

name: AJ
title: Good but Xbox is better
text: I own both a PS4 and an Xbox so this is going to be a direct comparison. I am not going to compare graphics of the two systems because they basically identical. One of the reasons I prefer Xbox over PS4 is the Xbox controller feels more comfortable in my hands. also I bought a battery pack for the controller and it lasts a lot longer than the PS4 rechargeable controller. I find I have to recharge my PS4 controller after several hours, even if I don't use it for a few days the battery dies. I also find Xbox user interface to be more intuitive. For some reason my PS4 hard drive filled up a lot quicker. I know not all games are the same size but after only installing 3 or 4 games on my PS4 the hard drive was almost full.I had to delete some demos and other things I had on there in order to free up space. I was able to download about a dozen games to my Xbox. Big ones like Halo 5 and red Dead redemption. I can only assume it has something to do with the differences and operating systems, the hard drives are the same size. The PS4 does not look aesthetically pleasing and when I pick it up it feels like a cheaper piece of equipment. This next reason is very important: I've had a lot of network issues with the PS4. ive had a lot of trouble getting on to the PlayStation Network and finding matches online. Nothing is more frustrating than trying to play a game with your friends and getting disconnected. I have not had the same problems with my Xbox. I did some research and a lot of people have been having the same issues with their PS4. The one advantage PS4 has is its share play feature, where you can share games with friends. I'll let you research that for yourselves. Xbox games seem to go down in price faster which is a good thing. PlayStation is seen as just a gaming system. They don't have a lot of apps for watching television or a Blu-ray player. Xbox has a built-in Blu-ray player and far more apps to download then PlayStation. it's not known as just a gaming system but an entertainment system.  Now I know PlayStation sold more consolesbut Xbox is an all-around better piece of equipment. If you're thinking about buying a console you might want to wait until next year when the new systems come out. Hope this review helped.

name: Outrun1986
title: Best game console on the market, an absolute must-own.
text: Best game console on the market, many very high quality games under $20 each, some even cheaper. This is the console that every gamer must own. I got one to play the Digimon games which you cannot play anywhere else. The interface is better than the PS3, which I also own and of course, the system is faster. I haven't had any problems with mine yet. The only problem is a lot of the TV network apps are missing, and the Spectrum TV app is missing so I cannot watch TV through this, I had to buy a Roku to access this stuff, but it would be nice if it was on Playstation so I could save space and cords in my entertainment stand. It would be especially nice if the Spectrum app was not missing as I could watch TV through my Playstation and not have to buy an extra device to do that, especially important since Spectrum no longer offers cable through a wire that plugs into the back of your TV, you have to either pay a very expensive monthly fee for a cable box or find a way to access the app to watch TV. This app is on Xbox so I don't know why its not on Playstation. I am not buying another gaming system just to access an app.

name: LD
title: Disappointing...
text: I've owned the PS4 since launch (and therefore paid upwards of $500 for it) and it has to be said...it is really disappointing.  In my opinion Sony really dropped the ball with the PS4.  I am 35 yo and have owned every Playstation that has come out, the first PS, PS2 (which I had and used for 10 YEARS with no issues), the original PS3, a PS3 slim (which I had to buy to replace my PS3 fat when it died 3 years after purchase), and now a launch PS4.  The god's honest truth is I still use my PS3 slim more than I use my PS4, even to this day.  The ONLY thing that the PS4 does that the PS3 can't is play PS4 games, THAT'S IT!  Unless you are a hardcore console gamer (which I am not, I am mostly a PC gamer), the PS4 is and always has been a total waste of money.  I bought the PS4 as a home theater device, to do everything, and I expected it to be at least somewhat future proofed with the firmware updates.  The fact that it can't play 4k blu rays or stream in 4k is a massive disappointment.  I am now in the position of having to purchase something else (PS4 pro, Xbox One S, Roku, etc) in order to take advantage of my 4k TV.  If you are looking at one of these now, certainly don't bother, get the Pro.

title: Great system....
text: I've owned a PS4 since launch, they had some issues with the OS. You couldn't erase notifications, getting messages and notifications from a party after you've left/deleted it, things like that. They have  worked out most of the issues, auto update is still a little funky but is acceptable. The console hardware is top notch, of coarse. Great graphics and game play. SUPER  reliable., I'm still on my original system (bought when original Destiny was released). I put hundreds of hours every winter on this thing and it just keeps working  I've owned every Playstation yet and this is my favorite. The dualshock I got with the system had the L3 button go out. It was in warranty so they took it and "fixed" it but when it came back the L3 button worked but the left stick didn't work properly anymore. Bought a new one and still have it but the battery life is bad. Bought a new one a few months ago and the battery life on the new ones are much better. Left a bad review earlier but after spending some time with it and some software issues being resolved I wanted to set the record straight. Great system..

name: Lonnie K. Coates, Jr.
title: Good System, but Sony Has No Respect for their Fans
text: The PS4 is a good system. It has a decent selection of games, from fighting games, to shooters, and ect. Despite the positives, the PS4 does come with some drawbacks. You can't use a laptop hdd, internally, that is larger than 2TB due to a physical size restriction, you can't play 4K Blu Ray discs on this console, but you can do this on most Xbox One consoles, and crossplay support on the system is not that great on the system. The big offender for me is how Sony starting to censor certain Japanese games for there sexy content such as Senran Kagura Burst Re:Newal, and the upcoming Super Neptunia RPG. Frankly I find this grossly disrespectful to their fanbase by them treating us like a bunch of babies. Honestly, if you like JRPGs, just get Switch (and a PC), and let Sony know that they're terrible for treating their fans like this.

name: Colin
title: Worth every penny!
text: Got this last year and has been using this wonderful console ever since. I don't have a 4K TV so this PS4 Slim model is exactly what I need. There are plenty of storage and if needed, I can always purchase additional external hard drives for more room. Playstation has so many great exclusives: so far I played the Uncharted series, Horizon Zero Dawn, and Crash Bandicoot; while God of War, The Last of Us, Shadow of the Colossus, Bloodborne, Yakuza, Detroit: Become Human, and Gravity Rush 2 are on my to-play list next. I also played other multi-platform games like FFXV, Assassin's Creed (Ezio trilogy and Unity) and Dynasty Warriors 8, which all ran very smoothly. Boot time is extremely quick and with backwards compatibility, I can also enjoy playing other PS3 games. In addition, the Playstation online store always have really good flash sales in which even AAA title games are 60-80% off so it does definitely pay off to keep an eye out for those.

text: I was given this for Christmas from my dad, who purchased this on his account. It will blink a blue light "of Death" (that name was given from other consumers, as ive  googled this problem) and now I deal with constant losing of gaming data, not being able to play, and having an overall Crappy time on my PS4. When it shuts off, it doesnt respond to controllers or pressing of the power button. If I'm lucky, it'll eventually go into Safe Mode. It has prevented me from enjoying full lengths of movies, and I've realized now, as the problem gets worse and worse, I cannot even get through one 20 minute episode of the Office without it Shutting Off. the Playstation helpline has been useless, it'll say please hold for your place in line, and I've not once made it to be able to discuss this issue with them before the page "expires".

name: Patrick L
title: XBOX SUCKS
text: A Better Playstation The Sony Playstation is a state of the art console gaming system. It can run endless amounts of games as well as stream movies, TV shows, and even music. It is a great piece of technology and I am proud to have one in my home. Playstation also features a symmetrical design on its controllers as well as on the console itself, so it is even satisfying to just look at. With all of these upsides to a Sony Playstation there has to be a couple downsides. There is not very much storage to hold games and the fan gets loud when running large online games. Other than these issues, the PS4 is an excellent console.Playstations are a perfect example of modern technology. They are equipped with massive graphics chips that can run hundreds of games. Everything from Call of Duty to even fitness games are available for the PS4.  Playstations truly are state of the art consoles. This console is guaranteed to bring its owner joy. Every time I start up my PS4 I get immediate happiness towards it because I know I will have fun.  The PS4 comes from a long line of predecessors so it has had time to evolve into the beast of a gaming machine that it is. Sony has gone through ups and downs with its gaming consoles. However the PS4 lies amongst their greatest achievements. With all of these great features available on the PS4, there are of course some downsides.Unfortunately the Playstation only comes standard with a single terabyte of storage. This is only enough to hold a maximum of seven to ten games. If a Playstation owner wishes to keep more games than this, he or she has to plug in an external storage source, like a USB drive or external hard drive. Video games take up massive amounts of storage and need to be saved on massive hard drives, so personally I believe the console could use more storage. When I buy a video game I like to keep it, so to me it is basically throwing money down the drain when I have to uninstall an old game to make room for a new one. The PS4 could definitely use more storage to keep even more games.Another problem with the Playstation is its fan. When running large games, especially online ones, the fan is obnoxious. I have to use headphones sometimes because the volume of the fan is louder than the volume of my television. I have always seen the solution to this noise as better air flow to the console. By propping up the console and keeping it in a cool area the fan does not seem to be as loud, but it is still clearly there. If Sony designed their playstation with better air flow, I believe the loud fan problem will be fixed.Overall I love the Sony Playstation. It is an excellent gaming console and I will probably own one for as long as I play video games. The PS4 runs games efficiently and usually with no problems. The only things that need to be fixed on the PS4 are its storage and the loud fan. Other than those two small complications, the system is excellent and is at the top of its class in video gaming consoles.

name: Amazon Customer
title: A Great Console
text: For years, there has been much debate and comparisons between Playstation and Xbox over who has the superior product. No matter which console system you decide to choose, you cannot go wrong with the PlayStation 4 Slim. This product offers a smaller and cheaper step into the PlayStation world. This world offering exclusive game titles, streaming services, and much more. Although it is smaller in size, the Slim provides a great experience for anyone of any age on a budget who shares an interest in gaming.DesignThe PlayStation 4 console series provides options to choose between separate types of the PlayStation 4 to fit the best needs and budgets of its users. For the Slim specifically, it is similar to the PlayStation 4 Pro’s build and comes with the same color variability as well as the plastic matte exterior making the product noticeably lighter given the size. The Pro design is measured at 12 x 10.8 inches while the Slim comes in at 11.3 x 10.4 inches. Although, the Pro may offer more due to its higher price, all of the basic needs for a gamer are found in the Slim for a cheaper price and almost the same design.DurabilityAn unorthodox example of this product’s durability was when I accidentally spilled water on the exterior of the Slim. I was terrified that my PlayStation would never work again and I would be out of a gaming console. After cleaning the Slim off, and making sure it was as dry as possible, I found no issues whatsoever. This accident happened a few months ago and I still have yet to have problems. I cannot guarantee this will be the same for all products but it just proves how durable this product really is. Also, this product has great mobility. As long as you are being cautious with the cords that come with it, it is easy to take to and from. I am able to fit the Slim into my backpack comfortably with its accessories and bring it on the road with no problems. This product continues to surprise me with its excellent durability.MediaWhat separates Playstation apart, is it’s offering of exclusive titles only to it’s consoles. The titles including Uncharted, The Last of Us, and God of War. Although they provide exclusive titles, there are still hundreds of games both physically and digitally available for this product. If you subscribe to the PlayStation Network, which is an additional fee, you’ll be able to gain access to even more titles which can be downloaded right to your library. It also offers membership discounts, sales, free games and the opportunity to play with your friends as well as other gamers around the world. Aside from games, it also provides many other apps and streaming services such as Netflix, Hulu, Youtube or whatever streaming service your heart desires! You can play music through Spotify and other apps directly off of the PS4.There are many advantages that comes with this product such as it’s design, durability and the media it provides. It offers a great first step into PlayStation’s world at an inexpensive price for any person of any age. It comes as a great option, whether it be for kids, teens, and even adults. Despite its size, the PlayStation 4 Slim is a great console that is your own home entertainment system.

name: Ryan Murray
title: Price gouging
text: On PlayStation website they are 300. This is a rip off! I just bought mine there!

name: KJB
title: This is a good low costing PlayStation 4
text: This is a good low costing PlayStation 4. Its can play a very wide range of new games on the market without trouble. It also has a slim console which can be both a good and bad thing depending on what you are using it for, and how long you’re using the system. At a low price and a full terabyte of memory it’s a very good bargain.Getting a PS4 which is currently at the front of console entertainment for under 300 dollars is already a good deal. Do remember if this is the first time your buying a PlayStation you will also have to purchase games, which range anywhere from 30 to 60 dollars per game. But to get a brand new PS4 and a few games to play starting out for under 500 dollars is a good deal.Also, if you have a Netflix subscription you can stream hundreds of TV shows and movies straight to your television. If you get a PS4 I would highly recommend getting a Netflix or Hulu subscription for a low price per month.You have a lot of potential when you get a full terabyte of memory for games and other features. Many play stations do not have that much memory, and often have to purchase an external memory drive. With this model of PlayStation, you still have the option of using external memory drives but more than likely will not need to unless used in excess.The slim model of the PlayStation is both a benefit and a potential issue. When using the PlayStation for long periods of time (3 hours or more) it will often get hot and could potentially over heat. This can be easily solved by a small USB computer fan to keep it cool. Keeping the top of the system open with nothing on top of it can also help this issue. However, this issue aside the slim design is a good design and is much more compact than other PlayStation.If you decided to buy a PlayStation and it is your fist time buying a PlayStation or a console like system I recommend buying a couple various kinds of games. An open world combat game could be more to your liking or a first-person shooter like Battlefield 1 or Overwatch.  I would also recommend looking into Fort Night a free to play game on the PlayStation store.

name: Cavan
title: Optical drive fails after hardly any use, half the price of console to fix.
text: The price should really be about $550 once you consider the optical drive failing and the cost of repair, which I’m sure they have. I bought a PS4 slim brand new and am an extremely light user. I mean I buy a game maybe once or twice a year. And after a year and a half of mostly just sitting there, the optical drive completely fails. And I can send it to Sony for $150 or take it to someone local where I find out my particular model of optical drive is $100 so with labor and tax comes out to be $150 give or take. So if I am to continue to play my games, I either have to shell out $300 for a new system or half that to replace my old system. Garbage product, criminal customer service. This console has made my console purchase easy, XBOX.

name: John Doe
title: Now Slimmer! An easy 5

And the main reason is that truthfully when I bought one, the only game I wanted to play was the black ops 2 game. Which sony doesn't do. So I will be going back to the xbox one. But I wouldn't hesitate to get a ps4 again or even the ps5.

name: J. Summers
title: Can't Even Replace the PS3 - Epic Fail on DVD/BluRay
text: I wanted to actually upgrade from Playstation 3, but Playstation 4 totally misses the mark on being the whole-life-replacement that the Playstation 3 was.  For me, I use Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, and DVD/BluRay about 500x more often than gaming features, which isn't to say I don't use gaming features, haha.  But Playstation 4 requires an extra step to get to the first 3 which requires loading a completely stupid TV menu (and loading, of course, wastes time).  And PS4 COMPLETELY FAILS on DVDs and BluRay.  Yes, they play.  Fine.  Glitches for some, but not for me.  But every time a disc is put in, the PS4 loads it like it's the first time.I need a system that remembers the last dozen or more DVDs/BluRay I've put in, because I use home workout DVDs on a constant rotation, 2 per day and different each day.  Half of them have annoyingly long first-time loading segments.  PS3 skips these after I've used the disc once.  Totally perfect.  PS4 doesn't even remember THE LAST DISC USED!  So, yeah, I ripped out the PS4 and plugged back in the PS3.I haven't decided whether I'm keeping the PS4 yet for gaming, but it sure as heck can't replace the PS3.  The PS3 makes every other system obsolete for every purpose except gaming.  The PS4 can't even replace its own predecessor!!  Epic fail for non-gaming.Other cons: (1) Huge push for community features makes every single screen obnoxiously full of stupid community options (as my boyfriend said: they could at least ASK you if you give an F about that crap, and let you turn it off).  (2) turning it on and off is now a stupidly long affair.  It was bad enough to have to hit the PS button, tap down to turn off the system, and confirm (PS3).  Now, if you don't want it to rest, you have to scroll through multiple menus.  Geez.  (3) POP UPS you can't turn off.  Again, the controller battery reminders were bad enough on the PS3, but now "Discovery"?!  And never anything I care about.  Ridiculously horrible user experience!  If they cared what WE wanted rather than just trying to sell their stupid features, they'd ask a brief survey during setup to see what kind of user you are, and then tailor Discovery to you, at least.  Or, I don't know: Give us the option to shut off their intrusive pop-ups?—you know, the most hated UI element ever in the history of technology?I hate the PS4.

name: Patrick Fewell
title: Useless piece of garbage
text: Useless piece of garbage. Almost every time there is an update, it bricks the PS4. I have to completely wipe out the system and reinstall everything to get it working again. This is kept at my ex's house, and it is a major pain for her to disconnect it, bring it to me, just so I can wipe everything back to a complete reinstall of the operating system. A manual update does not work. It has to be a manual reinstall of everything. Such a horribly bad design. Whats worse is that wifi does not work on a manual install. It has to be by cat5/6 cable or by a usb flash drive. Unfortunately, there is no tv by the router, and the computer cannot take HDMI inputs, making this even harder. I never have to deal with these problems with the Xbox one. Updates should not brick the system, even with novice users. Manual updates that are provided should work. What is the point of allowing people to download an update, if they work 0% of the time? Sony had better think twice if they expect me to ever waste another dime on the ps4 with updates like this.

name: Nadav Har'El
title: Get a different console....
text: I bought my son this console because he asked, and now sorry about not convincing him to get the XBox instead.It looks like the PlayStation was literally designed to annoy me. Setting it up was hell, taking hours. Then I realized that Sony is like an even worse kind of Apple, patronizing over its customers and enjoying making them jump through hoops all the time. Examples? I have many:1. I truthfull entered my son's young age, and lo and behold - he can't watch youtube because he's not 13. Not even if I remove all "parental restrictions".2. We bought several games on CDs, and now my son needs to switch those CDs physically to play, despite the full copy of the game being copied to the hard disk? Why? Because what the heck, we are Sony, and we own you. So annoying.3. I was asked to choose which age-level games I wanted my son to play. Setting anything except "all ages" means that he can't play most games, even silly benign games, so I had to remove this restriction. Nice ass-covering, Sony!4. The playstation doesn't support our language, Hebrew. I did not expect Hebrew translations, just a simple Hebrew keyboard so my son can type Hebrew strings into search boxes in the browser, etc. WTF? Every $50 android supports a Hebrew keyboard. Microsoft X-Box supports Hebrew. Only Sony doesn't. Who cares that there are about 7 million people who want this language.5. The Netflix version on PS4 is full of bugs. E.g., I'm stuck on one of the 5 Netflix users, and can't change it. Why?All this would be OK (or NOT!) for some $50 gaming machine. Not for a system I just spent over $400 on (console, extra controller, games). Stay away!

name: sean f
title: I dont care how good the graphics are for this system
text: I dont care how good the graphics are for this system. The customer service for PlayStation is absolutely appalling. They were perfectly happy taking my money when I purchased a game through their awful store but when they couldn't deliver the pre order bonus that was promised to me they told me to contact the developer and then hung up on me. TWICE!!!!! When I say they have the worst customer service I have ever experienced, it is an understatement. I WILL NEVER EVER BUY ANY SONY PRODUCT EVER IN MY LIFE!!!!! Save your sanity and use an AMERICAN COMPANY such as XBOX. Xbox's customer service is amazing and I have never had a problem.

name: Kay
title: ATTRACTS ROACHES!
text: We only had this a month before it stopped powering on anymore. When I disassembled the console, I found several *roaches* inside. We are fairly neat and don't usually see roaches around the house or even in the kitchen, but this is southeast Texas and they're kind of a fact of life here even with quality weather-proofing. They are attracted to the inside of this console because it's so compact and the power supply is inside, instead of in an external box like older models used to have, which makes the entire unit hot. This is a major design flaw in the first place, much less to not cover the ventilation points with mesh or something that will keep pests and dust out of it. We ordered a replacement power supply and I hope I'll be able to fix my machine, as I've discovered there's a provision in the warranty where it is voided if there are any insects found inside. This indicates Sony KNOWS about the problem and has not resolved it. If I can repair the machine, I'll have to bag it up in some screen or something just to keep it alive. X)

name: Lady Dame
title: This makes me wish I set my xbox on fire years ago
text: Ok, I have been a lifelong gamer and for the most part I stayed with Xbox, but after my experience with the Xbox One I will never purchase another Microsoft product again in my life. But that's not what this is about.The ps4 has been amazing. The ability to easily create multiple profiles for the people and visitors to my home, the ease of installation, updates, and locating information have made this system our favorite. While some might like that it plays DVDs and bluray, we actually like it for its ability to function without needing constant system or software updates that render it or the games unplayable (**** you xbox), which is wonderful for those of us that live rurally. The ps4 comes out of the box ready to play (after a very short initial set up) and the same can be said for the games.I will be buying another for our house because we enjoy this one immensely.

name: Elizabeth
title: Immediate Update is Frustrating
text: Everything is absolutely perfect, the console, the cables, and the controller came in new condition.  Everything hooked up easily.  The only issue I had was with the update that was needed for me to sign in to my ps account and basically do anything on the ps4.The first time I tried updating it, it said an error had occur and that it was unable to download, I kept trying and it just kept saying the same thing.  I even tried restarting it and creating another user account but nothing worked.Until I went to the notifications and clicked on the notifications that said the update couldn't download, and I deleted all of them.  I went back and tried updating again and it worked.Now that the update is in everthing is working perfect.If anything bad happens I'll update.
